page.title: 17Footpaths.
page.content: One of the joys of living in this district is the variety of delightful country walks. Public footpaths criss -cross the area, some twisting and turning through lush,green fields and others meandering through cool, leafy woods. Open-cast mining in the late '60s and early '70s obliterated many of these paths. The land has been returned to its natural beauty and it is the duty of everyone to walk these paths to ensure that they remain accessible to the public. In this way we can make certain that the rights of everyone to enjoy the beauty of the countryside is preserved. It is important to remember that these rights also bring obligations. We must remember to obey the country code when walking the paths. (Group A.) S.J.&C.B.
